snippet: Opponents of capital punishment were not surprised by the figure, but prosecutors said it was overstated.
abstract: Widely cited study published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences says some 4.1 percent of death row defendants are falsely convicted; opponents of capital punishment says they are not surprised by figure, but prosecutors dispute findings, saying it is overstated.
lead_paragraph: Opponents of capital punishment were not surprised by the figure, but prosecutors said it was overstated.

headline.main: 4.1% Are Said to Face Death on Convictions That Are False
